item.title: Sherrill add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "To make light of philosophy is to be a true philosopher." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Sherrill add a quote by Max Lucado
item.description:
"When you are in the final days of your life, what will you want?
Will you hug that college degree in the walnut frame? Will you ask to be carried to the garage so you can sit in your car? Will you find comfort in rereading your financial statement? Of course not. What will matter then will be people. If relationships will matter most then, shouldn't they matter most now?" -- Max Lucado

item.title: Sherrill add a quote by William Cowper
item.description: "Man may dismiss compassion from his heart, but God never will." -- William Cowper

item.title: Sherrill add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Good actions are the invisible hinges on the doors of heaven." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Sherrill add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Red hair, sir, in my opinion, is dangerous." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Sherrill add a quote by John Greenleaf Whittier
item.description: "Of all sad words of tongue or pen, the saddest are these, 'It might have been." -- John Greenleaf Whittier

item.title: Sherrill add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Sherrill add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Sherrill add a quote by Robin L. Smith
item.description: "Change is just a bend in the road, not the end of the road." -- Robin L. Smith

item.title: Sherrill add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain
